author: @shiningknight4267
text:
Ehhhh....try try try they will. I'm sure it will be an entertaining film. But.
There's only ONE Sonic 3. It is a 16 Bit game for the Sega MegaDrive/Genesis gaming system. It was produced in 1993 and 1994 and it belongs in the top 10 video games of all times. The game comes in 2 parts and when you join them together they form the complete game.
The game is perfect.
It has perfect fantasy, perfect story, perfect use of colours, perfect music and perfect anything else you can think of.
And I own hard copies of the game. Perfect.

author: @paolocaliego426
text: Shadow's voice acting in Sonic 3 is fantastic. Shadow and Maria's story sounds identical to mine and my cousin Simone's, who died on Tuesday, February 15, 2022 at 11:00 PM at the age of 32 due to a brain hemorrhage! his favorite characters were Tails and Shadow, but he couldn't watch Sonic2, released in April 2022, 2 months after his death, nor Sonic3, released almost 3 years after his death, the scenes where Sonic and Shadow bend down to help Tom and Maria, made me relive in my mind the moment when Simone died in my arms, it was Thursday the 17th at 3.15 in the morning when while I was hugging his body, he stopped breathing and his heart stopped forever, even though he had cerebrally not been among us for 28 hours before, I'm sorry he couldn't see the movies he was waiting for, and he only managed to see Tails in the final scene of Sonic1 in 2020, as in Shadow's heart also in mine THE LIGHT SHINES EVEN THOUGH THE STAR IS GONE!

author: @hqef616
text:
As far as sequels go, Sonic 3 is great. As a fan of the franchise I'm so glad they did this movie so well. There's plenty of easter eggs scattered throughout as well. It draws a lot from SA2B.
The narrative, the editing, the pace, it's very well done. Highly recommended. Reeves breathes life into his character and Carrey leans into Robotnik really well, he's a excellent fit. The next movies sure will be very well executed if this keeps up.

text: People will probably not agree with me, but I feel like this movie shouldâ€™ve been like 15 minutes more to be a lot better. It was still an amazing movie, but I feel like we shouldâ€™ve gotten a Knuckles vs Shadow fight and not just a beatdown of 10 seconds. More scenes of Gerald Robotnik with what he was trying to achieve with Shadow in the first place and his plan to take revenge. More screentime and love for Tails that he also gets to do something and if this was indeed Eggmanâ€™s last appearance from Jim Carrey. Then we shouldâ€™ve gotten more interaction between him and Sonic and especially in the final act of the movie.

I consider "You're a colorful bunch" to be close enough, though it isn't a reference.

Sonic: All right, we got a rogue alien on the loose. How do we find him?
Tails: Start with a giant fireball?
Sonic: I love it! Let's start with the giant fireball.

author: @RagnarKorg3141
text:
It already didn't make sense in Sonic X that Sonic was an alien and Shadow was a human-made being with an appearance identical to an alien hedgehog like Sonic.
So unless Shadow was a baby alien hedgehog that was rescued and genetically enhanced or Shadow was created with the DNA of an alien hedgehog that died on Earth 50 years ago, the problem will persist. The General saying that Shadow's story is similar to Sonic's is already partially intriguing, an orphan stranded on Earth and a being created in a laboratory I don't really call that similarity.

author: @theshawnmccown
text:
Now imagine if they had the guts to do a fully animated film like The Super Mario Bros. movie that was true to the look and feel of the Sonic series. The Super Mario Bros. proved that a fully animated movie that stayed true to the source material/property can be a huge hit. The same mistake with the Smurfs as with Sonic. These movies that mix live action with cartoon characters are a failed opportunity.

The Super Mario Bros. - $1,361,992,475 world wide.
Last two Sonic movies combined - $725,137,201 world wide.

author: @matthewmira3265
text:
While Iâ€™m not familiar with the games, but from the various comments and my research I did on Shadow in comparing it to what Iâ€™m seeing in the trailer, Shadow is well-written, especially with keeping in touch with the source material in Shadowâ€™s character in his many game appearances and his backstory. 0:36 Even the line that Commander Walters says summarizes Shadowâ€™s character â€œShadowâ€™s story began a lot like yours, Sonic. But where you found Family and Friends; Shadow found only pain and loss.â€œ. A dark, but tragically complex anti-heroic character with a very sympathetic backstory. Stoic, soft-spoken, aloof. His actions motivated by the loss and trauma of losing Maria Robotnik, someone he cared about deeply. While they still kept the dark, aloof, stoic, and brutal side of Shadow, they still showed that heâ€™s still a caring person and they managed give Shadow some level of humor, 1:08 â€œYouâ€™re a colorful bunch.â€
0:05 The Flames of Disaster.
0:43 The Wachowski family.
0:57 Enter 0:59 Team Sonic
1:10 Ben Schwartz/Sonic: We donâ€™t want to fight you.
1:11 Idris Elba/Knuckles: Actually Sonic, 1:12 I would like to fight.
1:15 1:22 Shadow Teleportation ability
1:17 Shadow injuring Knuckles
1:32 Shadow skating on the water via his Air Shoes
1:37
1:49 Eggman now with a fat belly like his videogame counterpart.
2:01 Eggman: Letâ€™s do this!
2:06 2:13 I didnâ€™t make the comparison until now, but the relationship between Eggman and Stone reminds of Mr. Charles Montgomery Burns and Waylon Smithers. Similar to how Smithers is undyingly loyal to Burns no matter what, Stone is undyingly loyal to Eggman.
2:21 Shadowâ€™s superspeed
2:22 When weâ€™re done, there wonâ€™t be anything left
2:29 Ben Schwartz/Sonic: What did you do?!
2:30 Keanu Reeves/Shadow: What I had to.
2:32
2:34-2:36
2:43 2:46 Jim Carrey as Robotnikâ€™s grandfather, Gerald Robotnik.

author: @adamstephens8220
text:
For those wondering about Amy.
A reliable source mentioned before again and again that Amy will appear in sonic movie 3, though her role is obviously being kept under wraps.
So the best bet is simple,
Amy comes in to save team Sonic, helps them get on space colony Ark and convince shadow.
And the reason why she there, obviously to meet Sonic, similar to tails but unlike tails, Amy really wanted to meet Sonic.
Her role might be minor in a movie like this but at least it will be a noticeable one.

author: @Fate376-u1d
text: Here's what you can say about Amy: in Google, in the list of actors, the name Amy was visible under the actress Sofia Pernas, I saw it this summer, and then the name Amy was removed. This was already on Imdb, where the name Amy was also under the actress Sofia Pernas and it was also deleted, it was a few months ago. That is, we can say that if something like this was removed, it means that most likely Amy Rose will be in this film. And by the way: at 1:39 there was only Knuckles' hair, there was no other pink hair of Amy Rose, and I watched this frame several times. Rouge will definitely not be in the film, because the actress who was considered the new voice of Rouge will play a living character, this is already written in Wikipedia. But Sofia Pernas still has not written her role and judging by the fact that on some sites it is written that she has a voice acting of some unknown character, then this means that it is most likely Amy Rose. So don't worry, Amy Rose will appear in the movie, even if it's just a couple of scenes.

text:
I just thought of something. You know how in Sonic 1, the goal is to reach San Francisco ? Well do you know what is in San Francisco ?

The Golden Gate, which inspired Radical Highway, Shadow's first stage, where he stands on in the cutscene before the level.

It would be cool if things went full-circle and Shadow in the movie gets to stand on the actual Golden Gate, reminescing about Maria similarly to the cutscene in the game.

author: @domenicoloriggio7315
text:
A inizio anno avevo detto che i tre film che aspettavo di piÃ¹ nel 2024 erano Joker 2, Il Gladiatore 2 e Sonic 3.

Dopo che avevo visto la recensione a tema Borderlands film dei Playerinside (ero in modalitÃ  "Shhhhh, il profeta parla" de La Rivolta delle Ex memoria) qui su YT avevo detto che se prendi dei buoni sceneggiatori e un buon regista e affianchi loro gli sviluppatori del videogioco che vuoi trasporre allora puoi fare un buon risultato altrimenti segui la scia di molti adattamenti videoludici rivelatisi poi fallimentari.

Detto questo buon primo trailer. Ãˆ andata esattamente come mi aspettavo. La base sarÃ  il videogioco Sonic Adventure 2. Il passato di Shadow verrÃ  accennato (si vedono Shadow e Maria interagire) ma probabilmente la sua storia passata verrÃ  esplorata in un altro prodotto (io ho giÃ  detto che farei una serie tv tipo Knuckles basata sul videogioco Shadow The Hedgehog). Buoni effetti speciali. Buone scene d' azione. Buona colonna sonora. Shadow veramente figo. C'Ã¨ il nonno di Eggman. Torna il dottor Robotnik interpretato da Jim Carrey. C'Ã¨ Shadow con la moto che fa molto Sonic All-Star Racing. C'Ã¨ un easter eggs di Shadow sulla moto che Ã¨ riferito all' anime Akira.

Si preannuncia come un buon film d' intrattenimento (insomma, un buon hamburger per utilizzare una metafora culinaria). Sicuramente ne arriveranno altri di trailer. E per fortuna prima dell' arrivo di Sonic 3 ad intrattenermi ci saranno al cinema Mufasa Il Re Leone e A Complete Unknown.

Magari qualche personaggio tra Amy, Cream, Vector, Scorpius e Rogue si vedrÃ  giÃ  in Sonic 3.

Io sono piÃ¹ propenso a credere che al massimo si vedrÃ  Amy. Gli altri, come anche Espio, se li terranno per un eventuale Sonic 4.

GexaD l' ha definito "probabilmente il film migliore di questa per il momento trilogia di Sonic". Sembra che che potrebbe esserlo. Ma lo scoprirÃ² dal 1 gennaio 2025.

N.B. Ai tempi del teaser di The Last of Us seconda stagione avevo detto che i migliori adattamenti tratti da un videogioco post primo film di Sonic erano The Last of Us serie tv, Fallout serie tv, CyberPunk Edgerunners, i due film Sonic, Super Mario Bros il film, Tetris, Arcane serie tv, Resident Evil Infinite Darkness e Resident Evil Death Island. Sonic 3 Ã¨ la conferma e mi auguro che Minecraft film live action segua l' esempio del franchise Sonic cinematografico. Sicuramente la lista si amplierÃ  visto che quella dei film/serie tv tratti dai videogiochi Ã¨ una branca che sta arrivando. Ma se ne parlerÃ  in futuro.

text:
0:37 Shadow the Hedgehog and Maria Robotnik.
- Maria Robotnik, suffering from a severe illness, was confined to the Space Colony ARK where her grandfather, Gerald Robotnik, sought a cure. She formed a bond with Shadow the Hedgehog, Gerald's creation. Her life ended abruptly during a G.U.N. raid on the ARK, as she was shot while aiding Shadow's escape.


Sonic the Hedgehog and Chris Thorndyke.
- Chris Thorndyke, suffering from complete with a shot of his tombstone, is considered by many to be ridiculously edgy to the point of hilarity from Sonic Omens (2020 video game)

author: @sonicxrich0789
text:
2:43 Professor Gerald Robotnik is a scientist and the grandfather of Maria Robotnik and Dr. Doctor Ivo "Eggman" Robotnik. A world-renowned scientist who is widely acknowledged as one of the greatest scientific minds of all time, Gerald was responsible for several groundbreaking creations, including his greatest achievement, Shadow the Hedgehog, making him a modern day scientific Da Vinci.

Over fifty years ago, Gerald was asked by the President of the United Federation to lead Project Shadow, a medical program for inventing immortality, which he accepted in hopes of finding a cure for a fatal illness afflicting Maria. Eventually, Gerald managed to create Shadow the Hedgehog, though not without drastic measures; he was taken into custody by the military when his work was deemed too dangerous. When learning that Maria had been killed by the military, Gerald slipped into madness and spent his last days plotting revenge against humanity.

text:
1:08, 2:22, 2:29
I hope Keanu realizes how important this is to us TRUE Sonic fans. He and Shadow have something in common. They're both badass without trying. They always seem to steal the spotlight regardless of the context. This has to be the greatest casting choice ever made in any video game based film. Words can't describe how lucky I feel to have been a diehard Sonic fan for 15 years, only to see this happen. This is gonna be one memorable Christmas.

author: @marshallmcdowell1270
text:
This is a long post with puns & many questions, but I will separate the puns from the many questions.


And now, the obligatory lame attempt for Sonic related word-play.

Looks like someone gets a sonic force.
Try to make heads or tails from this.
Remember to avoid cracking knuckles.
Anybody wanting to leave will go rogue.
Be one another's shadow from here.
Wade around near the shore for now.
A cyborg Santa would be Saint Robot Nick? (Robot Nixk Cage, Jr., Toons, Nack, Jonas, Swardson, Offerman?
Don't return to the age of Stone?
When you want to eat, have some chow?

(To be honest, after the first few jokes (maybe like the one about "Go Rogue"), I was reaching for stuff.

Try one's for Tom, the bee, the gator, the chicken, the Robot, and cream

author: @VGMR
text: Let's stop pretending this film franchise was meant for fans. Let's deconstruct and observe the problems so there's no further delusions about this series. Take one moment to inspect and realize the only things keeping these films together are nostalgia, colorful visuals and famous celebrities. It's important to think about this because these films aren't actually faithful to the Sonic series. They're outright shameless and insulting parodies of Sonic with dated pop-culture references, fabricated information, endless product-placement and characters who are either totally shallow or highly exaggerated. I'm going to watch this film to repeat the cycle of challenging these flaws because real fans deserved better than this exploitative buffoonery.

author: @da_real_c-wulph95
text:
After watching this, I had an idea. Ok, picture this:
"When I'm done, there won't be anything to save." Shadow kicks Sonic's a$$ and now the heroes are panicking and searching for a power buff for Blue Boy. Robotnik and his dad do science things and find the Gaia Manuscripts.
They use some fancy machine to draw on a power hidden in the earth, maybe cracking it in the process. This causes Dark Gaia to appear and Shadow gets more power, calling himself "The Ultimate Lifeform". Sonic also receives some of DG's essence, transforming into the werehog. The final battle is epic, Live and Learn gets remixed, and while the hogs fight, Tails and Knuckles take down Dark Gaia (somehow).
It's not perfect and I know SA2 is a lot more likely to be represented, but Unleashed is my favorite game and I want a live-action Werehog at some point in the films. This is coming from a fan voicing his (barely thought out) fan fiction on the internet. Please be civil with your replies.

author: @RenatoGPadilla
text:
Gerald being alive has SO many implications... Like, we KNOW Maria died, but if Gearld made it out, then maybe he's been trying to get back at GUN all these years.

Aside from that, I love that they're officially "Team Sonic" now. The Chao (Olive) Garden was a nice touch and don't think I didn't notice Shadow doing his ShTH Intro combo on the GUN soldiers during his prision break sequence! The Akira Slide was also phenomenal!

I HOPE Amy gets snuck in here somehow, because if they give the "Give them a chance" speech to someone else AGAIN I'm actually gonna be mad...

Also, Shadow is about to have the greatest prison escape sequence since Tai Lung.

This looks SICK!

author: @ghostchaser1631
text:
"Maria, I promise you...REVENGE!!"

Shadow looks awesome, his voice sounds awesome, I love how he punches his way out of the cryo chamber and...did he just break Knuckles' wrist?! That's so badass! I have the same question as Robotnik though: how is Gerald still alive? Wasn't he supposed to have died fifty years ago? Was he also placed in cryo stasis? As awesome as this trailer is it still leaves some questions that can only be answered by seeing the full movie which I will try very hard to do. My life is kind of upside down right now so this may be exactly what this Sonic/Shadow fan needs right now. Looking forward to December 20th. ğŸ¦”ğŸ¦”

author: @BlackBloodCombatClub
text:
So a couple things I noticed:
-Movie tales place mostly in Japan instead of San Francisco (except for the intro)
-Sonic is no longer wanted by G.U.N. and is working with them to stop Shadow
-Eggman doesn't awaken Shadow (Team Dark doesn't form?)
-Gerald Robotnik is alive and is Eggman's father instead of his grandfather

No complaints, just some of the differences I noticed from SA2. Of course they wouldn't adapt it 1 to 1 and changes aren't always bad.
I'm really looking forward to seeing this movie ^^
I can't wait to see what Jim Carrey does as both Robotniks.

author: @sonyachurch9482
text: AHHHH! SHADOW! I'm glad to see they've yet again succeeded in accurately portraying a character, especially one difficult to get right like Shadow. The line that punched me in the heart was "Where you found friends and family, Shadow found only pain and tragedy." I love my dark, gloomy badasses with tragic pasts and associate trauma. OG Mewtwo and Shadow the Hedgehog. They're like me except they're not weenies and can do something about the injustices foisted upon them. I would explode into bat shaped confetti and pumpkin spice lattes if Shadow got his own series.

author: @ian123asd
text:
Team Sonic getting whooped by Shadow in a 3v1 and needing to go to Eggman for help actually makes a lot of sense:

1) In other media like the games Shadow is basically Sonic's physical equal and is able to match his speed, with the addition of being strong enough to casually lift and throw cars (like Knuckles' strength), having air shoes that let him hover (kinda similar to Tails' flight minus the tails) plus a whole lot of chaos powers (eg chaos control, chaos spear, chaos blast, etc). So if you translate even his basic powers into the film, it would be like having to fight someone with Sonic, Tails and Knuckles' powers all in one- PLUS teleporting. Dude is already OP enough without needing any enough powerups.

2) since this is Shadow he isn't going to screw around and start making dumb mistakes in the middle of the fight, not to mention that

3) in shows like Sonic Boom and Sonic X he's been shown to be able to defeat Sonic and some of his friends simultaneously.

I was low-key worried they were gonna make Shadow weaker in this but seeing the trailer, they might actually go the opposite way and make his power level completely broken. Which is AWESOME

But now, watching this trailer, I think that was GERALD the whole time. text: So Sonic 3 is basically becoming a blended version of Sonic Adventure 2 and the titular Shadow the Hedgehog game in one. And itâ€™s also having the fact that Sonic is teaming up with Eggman to stop Shadow? This wasnâ€™t like in the original games and Sonic X where Eggman formed an alliance with Shadow to defeat Sonic and have Space Colony Ark blow up the moon. And Amy isnâ€™t even in the movie?! And GUN recruiting Sonic and his friends is basically like NEST recruiting the Autobots to save Earth from Megatron unlike in the original games where GUN originally wanted Sonic arrested because they thought he was Shadow. I hope that doesnâ€™t even happen in the movie. And Shadow is pulling off some John Wick on the soldiers.

author: @jacobvaladez-kh6tr
text:
Fun fact:
Shadow the Hedgehog made his debut in the 2001 game Sonic Adventure 2 for the Sega Dreamcast. Created by Sega as a counterpart to Sonic the Hedgehog, Shadow was designed with a darker, more mysterious persona. His origins are tied to the characterâ€™s complex backstory.

In the Sonic Adventure 2 storyline, Shadow was originally created by Dr. Gerald Robotnik, the grandfather of Sonic's arch-nemesis, Dr. Eggman. Gerald aimed to create the ultimate life form, combining the best attributes of various creatures. Shadow was intended to be a cure for his granddaughter Maria's illness, and he was infused with powerful Chaos energy to grant him extraordinary abilities.

Shadow's story involves amnesia and a quest for identity, which leads him into conflict with Sonic and his friends. His dark appearance and abilities, such as Chaos Control, set him apart from Sonic and introduced a new dynamic to the Sonic universe.

Shadow's character has evolved over time, exploring themes of redemption and purpose, and he has appeared in numerous games, spin-offs, and media related to the Sonic the Hedgehog franchise.

text: I feel like Eggman is gonna use Sonic's quill to create Metal Sonic in order to combat Shadow. But then, he would reveal this as a ploy later in the movie and double cross the gang so he can have his revenge. Which would force Somic and Shadow to have to team up and stop Eggman. But then after they're done, Shadow would continue being on his own as opposed to staying with Sonic and his friends. That would lead for more character development (whether in more movies or in a TV show format) for Shadow down the road to where he would eventually befriend everyone. But, this is just me theorizing here.

author: @BeefbossZilla2011
text:
In this epic finale to the sonic movie original trilogy, Sonic, Tails and Knuckles must take on the ultimate life form. Shadow, A hedgehog almost identical to sonic plans to end the world in the name of a deceased loved one. Sonicâ€™s speed, Tailsâ€™ brains And knuckles strength are put to the ultimate test as Sonic must find the chaos emeralds before shadow does. Based on the hit game from 2001, Sonic adventure 2, This movie is a massive love letter to the golden age of the sonic franchise and sonic himself will truly Live and Learn.
Sonic the hedgehog 3
In theatres December 20th

Shadow didnâ€™t get that luxuryâ€¦. He spent 50 years wallowing in pain, letting his hatred fester and grow.

author: @LeafyJolt
text:
When the world needed it the most, it came.

After what has felt like an eternity, from fake news to leaks, the trailer is finally here, and for real this time. As for me, Iâ€™d consider this an early birthday present for myself as my 18th birthday is coming up.

Considering that this movie takes a lot from Sonic Adventure 2, I hope to see and hear some references to that game in this, such as when Sonic confronts Shadow with â€œI found you, faker!â€.

We can all now finally Live and Learn in peace until December 20th. We â€˜gotta go fastâ€™ to that very date! ğŸ¦”ğŸ‰

author: @zekeram129
text:
Things that are NON-NEGOTIABLE with this film:
1. Maria gets gunned down by militaristic forces and it's not sugarcoated or de-fanged (I'm not saying you need to put it center frame with blood flying everywhere but it needs to be explicitly clear that Maria is murdered right in front of Shadow with no room for ambiguity)
2. Live and Learn plays during the movie's climax

Failure to meet these two benchmarks means that the movie itself has failed to properly adapt the source material in a meaningful way.

This has me thinking that that Sonic 3 movie will be part 1 of of a bigger story with Sonic 4 being the 2nd part based on the finale of SA2 game, but done in a different way.

Nice job Paramount and now it's definitely getting interesting and the trailer was worth the wait ğŸ˜ğŸ‘

text: Love this trailer. Only thing I was kinda iffy on is the use of the Green Hill theme. Like, I feel like the marketing should be using Adventure music or more Modern Sonic themes rather than going back to using the classic music. Shadow as a whole kinda symbolizes the move from classic Sonic to Modern Sonic, so I hope in future marketing they embrace the Adventure feel. Get Crush 40 in here to make a song for the trailer.

author: @jcarl8022
text: Let's hope the movie stays more faithful to the game and that they don't ruin Shadow's character. They should also make Sonic more like the Sonic from the games because, so far, this version of Sonic is cringeworthy. Possibly the worst version of the character, along with that mess of Sonic Boom, Sonic Prime, and Sonic IDW. I get that this is a different take, but it's a shame. So far, the only well-done characters are Tails and Knuckles. Plus, the story of Sonic Adventure 2 is one of the best, but since we understood from the last movie that Chaos doesn't exist, I'm unfortunately afraid that we won't even catch a glimpse of Amy, Rouge, or the Biolizard. (Also because there would be too many characters to handle, despite them being important for Shadow.) However, Black Doom, Maria getting shot, and Gerald being tortured in his cell are a must. If they don't show them, that's a serious issue.
